name: Bio-Active Ceramide Repairing and Plumping Moisturizer + Barrier Strengthening
about: What it is:A velvety moisturizer to defend against visible signs of aging, powered by bioactive ceramides for visible fine-line and wrinkle reduction..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Fine Lines and Wrinkles, Dryness, and Loss of Firmness and Elasticity.Formulation:Cream.Highlighted Ingredients:- 0.2% Bioactive Ceramides: Visibly smooth, firm, and support skin's moisture barrier..Ingredient Callouts:It is gluten-free and cruelty-free..What Else You Need to Know:This ceramide-rich moisturizer is clinically shown to improve six key signs of aging: fine lines and wrinkles, plumpness, firmness, lift, elasticity, and barrier function. The next-gen formula also delivers up to 24 hours of hydration and supports skin barrier from first use..Clinical Results:In a 4-week clinical study of 20 people:
ingredients: -0.2% Bioactive Ceramides: Visibly smooth, firm, and support skin's moisture barrier..-5% Gransil Blur: Blurs the appearance of fine lines..-3.5% Shea Butter: Nourishes and reduces skin's water loss to help protect the moisture barrier...Water (Aqua/Eau), Glycerin, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Propanediol, Polysilicone-11, C10-18 Triglycerides, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Pentaerythrityl Tetraisostearate, Cetearyl Olivate, Sorbitan Olivate, Cetyl Alcohol, Phenoxyethanol, Ceramide NP, Polyacrylate-13, Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, Ethylhexylglycerin, Polyglyceryl-10 Laurate, Ethylhexyl Palmitate, Laureth-12, Sorbitan Isostearate, HDI/Trimethylol Hexyllactone Crosspolymer, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Citric Acid, Sodium Hydroxide.‚Äã..The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.

I finally realized with my more mature skin that the products I had been using just haven‚Äôt been enough to help hydrate and protect it, especially my moisturizer as that is supposed to be your main skin protector. I almost went for a much more expensive moisturizer, but I decided I can save myself some $$ if this ends up working really well for me and if it doesn‚Äôt I can then always try one of the more expensive brands that I‚Äôve also been eyeing. Well I am here to tell you that I am SO glad that I made that decision and chose this face cream! Does it smell great? No of course not lol as it‚Äôs fragrance free, so I will admit I do miss the fragrance that was in my other moisturizer. That isn‚Äôt to say that it smells bad though. I think I may get some rose water or something similar to spritz on top just so I can get some fragrance on the days that I‚Äôd like some lol. I did opt for fragrance fee though as I‚Äôll be starting retinol and I really wanted a face cream without any added ingredients that may cause some irritation to that ‚Äútreatment.‚Äù Does it work well for dry skin, or dehydrated skin for that matter that can become a little sensitive or irritated due to the dehydration? The answer is heck yes it does!!! Going on it feels so smooth and creamy but not heavy. It really does help to hydrate my skin and calm it down if irritated from the elements. reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Gifted by Inky List, This New Moisturizer is a game-changer in the world of skincare. As someone with dry and sensitive skin, I am always on the lookout for moisturizers that are hydrating, soothing, and gentle on the skin, and this moisturizer ticks all the boxes. Firstly, the formula of this moisturizer is lightweight and non-greasy, making it perfect for daily use. It absorbs quickly into the skin without leaving any residue, allowing for easy application and layering with other skincare products. Despite its lightweight texture, it provides intense hydration, leaving my skin feeling plump and moisturized throughout the day. One of the standout ingredients in this moisturizer is squalane, a natural moisturizing factor that helps to replenish and restore the skin's moisture barrier. Squalane is known for its ability to lock in moisture and improve skin elasticity, resulting in a smoother and more supple complexion. I have noticed a significant improvement in the overall hydration and texture of my skin since incorporating this moisturizer into my routine. Another great thing about this moisturizer is that it is formulated without any unnecessary additives or fragrances. It is free from parabens, sulfates, and artificial fragrances, making it suitable for those with sensitive skin or those who prefer clean and minimalistic skincare products. I appreciate that the formula is gentle and non-irritating, as it does not cause any redness or breakouts on my sensitive skin. Overall, I highly recommend Inky List's New Moisturizer to anyone looking for a lightweight yet hydrating moisturizer. Its gentle formula, effective hydration, and clean ingredients make it a standout product in the skincare market. Give it a try, and you won't be disappointed!

reviews.review_text: Let me start by saying that many of these reviews seem to be incentivized, but I actually bought this moisturizer with my own money! It‚Äôs a basic, fragrance-free moisturizer that contains tried-and-true ingredients, such as shea butter and glycerin. Although it‚Äôs thick and creamy, it doesn‚Äôt leave me feeling greasy and it definitely does hydrate, which I appreciate. They describe this as a ‚Äúceramide-rich‚Äù moisturizer, but it only contains one ceramide (Ceramide NP), so I would have to disagree with that description. Comparatively, most CeraVe products include three. They also claim to be using ‚Äúnext-generation Bio-Active Ceramides,‚Äù which, according to the brand, are superior to traditional ceramides. I have never seen any other brand make this claim about the ceramides in their products, so I don‚Äôt know how true this is. Ultimately, if you‚Äôre looking for something that‚Äôs hydrating, affordable and sensitive-skin friendly, this would be a nice option. If you‚Äôre looking for something with a lot of antioxidants or active ingredients, you may want to pass on this.
